name.description: The name of the resource, also acts as it's unique ID

allowed_devices.description: Device types permitted to connect to server.

bind_address.description: Network address for the private network that will be created for clients. This network cannot conflict with any existing local networks

block_outside_dns.description: Block outside DNS on Windows clients.

debug.description: Show server debugging information in output.

dns_mapping.description: Map the vpn clients ip address to the .vpn domain such as example_user.example_org.vpn This will conflict with the DNS port if systemd-resolve is running.

dns_servers.description: Enter list of groups to allow connections from. Names are case sensitive. If empty all groups will able to connect

groups.description: Enter list of groups to allow connections from. Names are case sensitive. If empty all groups will able to connect

host_ids.description: The list of attached hosts to the server

inactive_timeout.description: Disconnects users after the specified number of seconds of inactivity..

ipv6.description: Enables IPv6 on server, requires IPv6 network interface

link_ping_interval.description: Time in between pings used when multiple users have the same network link to failover to another user when one network link fails.

link_ping_timeout.description: Optional, ping timeout used when multiple users have the same network link to failover to another user when one network link fails..

max_clients.description: Maximum number of clients connected to a server or to each server replica.

max_devices.description: Maximum number of devices per client connected to a server.

multi_device.description: Allow users to connect with multiple devices concurrently.

network.description: Network address for the private network that will be created for clients. This network cannot conflict with any existing local networks

network_end.description: Ending network address for the bridged VPN client IP addresses. Must be in the subnet of the server network.

network_mode.description: Sets network mode. Bridged mode is not recommended using it will impact performance and client support will be limited.

network_start.description: Starting network address for the bridged VPN client IP addresses. Must be in the subnet of the server network.

network_wg.description: Network address for the private network that will be created for clients. This network cannot conflict with any existing local networks

organization_ids.description: The list of attached organizations to the server.

otp_auth.description: Enables two-step authentication using Google Authenticator. Verification code is entered as the user password when connecting

ping_timeout.description: Timeout for client ping. Must be greater then ping interval

port_wg.description: Network address for the private network that will be created for clients. This network cannot conflict with any existing local networks

pre_connect_msg.description: Messages that will be shown after connect to the server

restrict_routes.description: Prevent traffic from networks not specified in the servers routes from being tunneled over the vpn.

search_domain.description: DNS search domain for clients. Separate multiple search domains by a comma.

vxlan.description: Use VXLan for routing client-to-client traffic with replicated servers.

nat.description: NAT vpn traffic destined to this network

network.description: Network address with subnet to route

block.description: The list of attached routes to the server

auth_type.description: User authentication type. This will determine how the user authenticates. This should be set automatically when the user authenticates with single sign-on.

bypass_secondary.description: Bypass secondary authentication such as the PIN and two-factor authentication. Use for server users that can't provide a two-factor code.

client_to_client.description: Only allow this client to communicate with other clients. Access to routed networks will be blocked.

dns_servers.description: Dns server with port to forward sub-domain dns requests coming from this users domain. Multiple dns servers may be separated by a comma.

dns_suffix.description: The suffix to use when forwarding dns requests. The full dns request will be the combination of the sub-domain of the users dns name suffixed by the dns suffix.

groups.description: Enter list of groups to allow connections from. Names are case sensitive. If empty all groups will able to connect.

mac_addresses.description: Comma separated list of MAC addresses client is allowed to connect from. The validity of the MAC address provided by the VPN client cannot be verified.

network_links.description: Network address with cidr subnet. This will provision access to a clients local network to the attached vpn servers and other clients. Multiple networks may be separated by a comma. Router must have a static route to VPN virtual network through client.

organization_id.description: The organizations that user belongs to.

port_forwarding.description: Comma seperated list of ports to forward using format source_port:dest_port/protocol or start_port-end_port/protocol. Such as 80, 80/tcp, 80:8000/tcp, 1000-2000/udp.

block.description: Use this data source to get information about the Pritunl hosts.
